results.title: The Last seduction
results.creator_credit: John Dahl, Jonathan Shestack and ITC Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: An updated film noir centering around Bridget Gregory, a beautiful, intelligent and ambitious femme fatal. After convincing her doctor husband to pull off a $700,000 cocaine deal, Bridget takes of with the money and hides out in a small town, where she meets Mike. She is tracked down by a private investigator hired by her husband. As the two start to close in on Bridget, she involves Mike in an elaborate scheme to keep the money and get rid of her husband. Cast includes: Linda Fiorentino, Peter Berg, Bill Pullman, J.T. Walsh and Bill Nunn. (Awards: New York)

results.title: The Last refuge
results.creator_credit: Michael Beckham and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines Paraguay under the Stroessner regime emphasising the regime’s corruption, use of torture and repression, and asylum for some of the world’s most wanted men. Exposes a number of personalities including ex-Nazi Adolf Mengele.

results.title: The Last plane out of Berlin
results.creator_credit: Jeff Watson, Frank Haines, ABC-TV (Australia) and Jeff Watson Productions
results.brief_description: This is a remarkable story about a remarkable Australian, Sidney Cotton, who was able to fool the German High Command to enable him to fly safely in and out of Germany as that country prepared for war. He took photographs that revolutionised aerial military photography forever. In fact his work in aerial espionage and photographic intelligence was to be instrumental in the foundation of the Photographic Reconnaissance Unit of the Royal Air Force. He worked on behalf of the French Deuxieme Bureau and the British MI6 and was a friend of Ian Fleming, creator of James Bond. Cotton was also a confidante of top ranking Nazis like Hermann Goering and Albert Kesselring and acted as a go-between in negotiations between Goering and the British Prime Minister, Neville Chamberlain. Born near Proserpine, Queensland, the son of a prominant Queensland grazier, Sidney Cotton, known for his continual defiance and love of adventure, was to be forever remembered as the one who flew the last civilian plane out of Berlin before the outbreak of World War II in 1939. He died in England in 1969 at the age of 74. Filmed as a docudrama with historical re-enactments and interviews with family, friends and former Air Force personnel. Also includes archival war footage, stills and home movies. Presented and narrated by Jeff Watson and filmed on location in Britain, Germany and Australia. Cast includes Geoffrey Morrell as Sidney Cotton and Jim Cullington as Field Marshall Kesselring.

group.title: Margaret Benson: compilation of nine 8mm home movies

results.title: The Last picture show
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Stephen J. Friedman, BBS Productions and Columbia
results.brief_description: Released in 1971 to critical acclaim and public controversy, this modern day classic directed by Peter Bogdanovich garnered eight Academy Award nominations (including Best Picture). It was hailed as “the most important work by a young director since Citizen Kane”. A frank, bittersweet drama of social and sexual mores in small-town Texas featuring a cast led by Timothy Bottoms, Jeff Bridges and Cybill Shepherd in her debut role. Cloris Leachman and Ben Johnson each won Oscars for their work in supporting roles. The characters created by Larry McMurty in his compelling novel are vividly brought to life in one of the most engaging coming-of-age stories ever filmed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Bogdanovich, Stephen J. Friedman, BBS Productions and Columbia

results.title: The Last of Us Part II
results.creator_credit: Kurt Margenau, Anthony Newman, Neil Druckmann, Halley Wegryn Gross and Naughty Dog
results.brief_description: Five years after the events of The Last of Us, Ellie embarks on another journey through a post-apocalyptic America on a mission of vengeance against a mysterious militia.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Kurt Margenau, Anthony Newman, Neil Druckmann, Halley Wegryn Gross and Naughty Dog

results.title: The Last of Us
results.brief_description: A third person shooter/stealth/survival hybrid, in which twenty years after the outbreak of a parasitic fungus which takes over the neural functions of humans, Joel, a Texan with a tragic familial past, finds himself responsible with smuggling a fourteen year old girl named Ellie to a militia group called the Fireflies, while avoiding strict and deadly authorities, infected fungal hosts and other violent survivors.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

results.description:
Joel, a ruthless survivor with few moral lines left to cross, lives in one of the last remaining Quarantine Zones. These walled-off, oppressive cities are run by what’s left of the military. Despite the strict martial law, Joel operates in the black market of the city, smuggling contraband for the right price.

Joel is asked by a dying friend to look after Ellie, a fourteen-year-old girl with courage beyond her years. What starts out as a simple job to deliver Ellie to another Quarantine Zone, soon transforms into a profound journey that will forever change Joel and Ellie.

As they journey across a post-pandemic United States, Joel and Ellie will encounter different factions of survivors that have each found a unique way of dealing with the infected humans, the lack of supplies, and the threat of other survivors. As Joel and Ellie struggle to persevere, they must learn to trust each other and work together in order to survive the realities of this new world.

results.title: The Last of the Mohicans (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Hunt Lowry and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Daniel Day-Lewis and Madeleine Stowe star in this adaptation of James Fenimore Cooper’s classic tale of a white man raised by Mohicans and who becomes embroiled in a clash between two strong and rival nations. Set in the American colonies during the bitter Anglo-French war of 1757, Daniel Day-Lewis as Hawkeye brings strength and passion to the role. This film is typical of the epic romantic sagas with its fast action, breathtaking scenery, spectacular battle scenes and a superb cast.

results.title: The Last of the Mohicans
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Hunt Lowry and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Set in the American colonies during the brutal Anglo-French war of 1757, this fierce romantic adventure chronicles the story of Hawkeye (Daniel Day-Lewis), a whiteman raised by Mohicans, wo becomes entangled in a raging battle between the two rival nations. Exhilarating and exciting, this is adventure on a grand scale, with heart-stopping action, sizzling romance (between Day-Lewis and Madeleine Stowe) and spectacular battle scenes. An epic tale of love and loyalty, this is great entertainment and should not be missed.
